data.title: All-Marion County football team: Ben Davis QB Thomas Gotkowski named Player of Year
data.meta_description: Ben Davis' Thomas Gotkowski, Mark Zackery IV and Russ Mann, Lawrence North's Davion Chandler win County awards. See who else made all-county team.
data.text:
Ben Davis senior quarterback Thomas Gotkowski is the Marion County Player of the Year by a vote of the county coaches.

Gotkowski, a two-year starter and Miami (Ohio) recruit, has completed 57.8% of his passes for 2,523 yards and 31 touchdowns with five interceptions for the 12-1 Class 6A state finals-bound Giants. Gotkowski has also rushed for 341 yards and six TDs.

What we learned: Even in defeat, Center Grove shows championship pedigree

Ben Davis coach Russ Mann is the Marion County Coach of the Year. Mann, a former assistant, took over as the Ben Davis coach this season and led the Giants to Saturday’s Class 6A state finals against Crown Point.

Other individual honors went to Lawrence North junior wide receiver Davion Chandler, who was named the county’s Offensive Player of the Year after catching 41 passes for 787 yards and 13 touchdowns for the 7-4 Wildcats, and Ben Davis junior Mark Zackery IV, the Defensive Player of the Year. Zackery has 37 tackles, four interceptions, three fumble recoveries and two caused fumbles, along with 47 receptions for 736 yards and seven TDs on offense.

Here is the full all-Marion County team:
